title: Design Thinking-Based Medical Education Innovation Project

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Project-based learning environment for pre-service teachers to creatively address modern challenges in medical education. Learning spaces enabling digital resource access via personal devices

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to systematically resolve complex problems in medical education settings by applying the design thinking process.
Strengthen the competency to design student-centered, problem-solving-oriented medical education curricula.

Learners, organized into teams of four, can select one real-world medical problem (e.g., patient data classification, diagnostic assistance systems), develop a Python-based AI prototype (with at least three functions) within 12 weeks, and obtain an average score of 3.5 or higher on a 5-point scale from an expert evaluation panel.

Learners can develop educational materials (three or more lecture slide sets, ten or more quiz items) using generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, MidJourney), document AI-driven problem-solving strategies as a five-step process, and achieve a score of 4 or higher (out of 5) in at least two of three rubric criteria (clarity, practicality, innovativeness) through peer evaluation.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
